title: Task detail
description: Detailed information about a specific task

metadata.description: The contents of the <task name>.json metadata file. This will be empty if the file doesn't exist, or is empty. Otherwise it is allowed to return arbitrary keys here.

files.description: A list of executable files associated with the requested task, and data about them. The data is intended to assist in fetching their contents from the task file-content endpoint.

items.description: A single file associated with the requested task, and data about it.

filename.description: The name of the file (which should match the second part of the task name) plus its extension.

sha256.description: The SHA256 of the contents of the file.

size_bytes.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

uri.description: Information on how to request the file contents from a Puppet master node. This will only provide a relative path, since clients may want to request from a compile master instead of the primary master.

path.description: A relative URI for accessing the task contents. A client can form the full URI by requesting 'master:port/path?params'.

params.description: A map of query params to use when requesting task contents. Required to include in the URI when making a request for task contents.

environment.description: The environment the task is in, a required query param on request to task contents.
